Tonight I arrived home from work before her to be greeted by a terse note that read:` Peel potatoes, light fire, walk dog. X' I appear to be paying a high price for a low-cost publication. Sunday. Media reports during Egypt's political unrest had quoted Zahi Hawass as saying that looters damaged two mummies, but in a BBC interview on Sunday he said that this was not the case. They were not mummies, there were two skulls taken outside from the CT scan machine. Everything will go back to normal at Cairo Museum today, said Zahi Hawass , head of Egypt's antiquities authority since 2002. He was made a cabinet minister last week.
